definition: to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
didn't expect

sentences.english: A fire burns in the cauldron, as a reminder of the Olympic flame.
sentences.chinese: 火炬塔裏燃燒着一團火焰，讓人想到奧林匹克聖火。

sentences.english: Thee sight of these pictures made me remember my own childhood.
sentences.chinese: 看到這幅畫讓我想到了我的童年時代。

sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 誰曾想到一三色堇可能是這樣一個頑皮的花。

sentences.english: I can think of the most romantic thing is to learn social dance.
sentences.chinese: 我能想到的最浪漫的事，就是學會跳交誼舞。

sentences.english: It's going to go to where there's less moles.
sentences.chinese: 我想到摩爾數少一點的地方。

sentences.english: He thought of here, go down the windows fly.
sentences.chinese: 他想到這兒，順着窗戶飛了下去。

sentences.english: Finally, find out who the editor is.
sentences.chinese: 最後，還應想到編輯是誰？

sentences.english: It's so obvious, why didn't they have them before?
sentences.chinese: 這就很顯而易見，爲何之前的人沒想到呢？

sentences.english: The Thunderbolt gained fame as the most powerful and actively used American fighter-bomber used extensively for targeting ground installations.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到雷電因此成爲了美國最著名的戰鬥轟炸機。

sentences.english: Such sigh absolutly come from no excuse. such as suddenly thought of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 若干感慨，簡直無來由，比如忽然想到生死。

sentences.english: At the flower show I thought of that Christmas card.
sentences.chinese: 在花展上我想到了那張聖誕賀卡。

sentences.english: When Donald Trump watches The Walking Dead, he thinks of us.
sentences.chinese: 川普看美劇《行屍走肉》的時候會想到我們。

sentences.english: She could have thought of nothing more likely to please her brother than this praise of Maggie.
sentences.chinese: 她本該想到沒有比讚揚瑪琪更能使她哥哥高興的了。

sentences.english: I - (3) - to think what has happened to the nuclear reactor.
sentences.chinese: 我一想到那個核反應堆所發生過的事情就擔心不已。

sentences.english: None of them thought of looking at the ricks.
sentences.chinese: 他們誰也沒想到要看麥垛一眼。

sentences.english: We didn't really expect it to start raining so at the first pit stop we kept the old tyres.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒想到會下雨，所以在一停後沒有換胎。

definition: to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to talk about/to mention/(preposition) as for
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to mention/to speak of/to lift/to pick up/to arouse/to raise (a topic, a heavy weight, one's fist, one's spirits etc)
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
to remember/to recall
to mention/to raise (a subject)/to refer to
as for/when it comes to
to think/to feel
unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
to see
it may be assumed that
presumably/probably/in all likelihood/surely
can't help (doing sth)/can't refrain from
perhaps/maybe
